items.sentence: I don't think that Tom knows when Mary will leave for Australia.
Tom said that everybody he usually hangs out with speaks French.
I don't think that Tom had anything to do with the bank robbery.
I don't think that I'd be able to convince Tom to do that again.
I don't think that I need to tell Tom Mary wants him to do that.
I suspect that Tom knows that he doesn't really have to do that.
When did you first suspect that it was Tom who stole your money?
Tom certainly understands we all need to attend today's meeting.
I think you should give Tom a chance tell his side of the story.
I don't think Tom knows what time Mary's train will be arriving.
I don't think Tom knows what Mary is going to do this afternoon.
I don't think Tom knows how much money was stolen from the safe.
I don't think Tom is going to get fired, at least not this week.
I don't think I've ever heard Tom complain about Mary's cooking.
I don't think I need to tell Tom that Mary wants him to do that.
I don't think I could stand to spend three hours alone with Tom.
I was surprised when Tom told me that he didn't need to do that.
Tom told me that he didn't have very much experience doing that.
Tom told me that he didn't know anyone who lived on Park Street.
Tom told me that he didn't want to wait until Monday to do that.
